Title: To what extent could we detect field defects? An extended empirical study of false negatives in static bug-finding tools
Elements_risk_assessment: we extract bugs and the faulty lines of code that are responsible for the bugs.
Summary:
an empirical study that investigates the effectiveness of five state-of-the-art
static bug-finding tools (FindBugs, JLint, PMD, CheckStyle, and JCSC) on hundreds of
reported and fixed defects
Outcome: although many field defects could be detected by static bug-finding tools, a substantial proportion
